decks.notes: The main focus of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced, aggressive strategy centered around Spirit creatures. Using a combination of disruptive spells like Spell Queller and Skyclave Apparition, along with powerful Spirit lords like Supreme Phantom, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage quickly. Mausoleum Wanderer and Spectral Sailor provide additional utility and flexibility, while Wedding Announcement offers a way to generate tokens and maintain pressure. Overall, the deck is designed to apply constant pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up a strong board presence by playing creatures with high devotion to green, utilizing cards like Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner and Leyline of the Guildpact to ramp up mana production. Storm the Festival and Invasion of Ixalan help to further strengthen the board with additional creatures. With a mix of powerful creatures like Cavalier of Thorns and Old-Growth Troll, supported by mana accelerants like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive and efficient green devotion strategy.

The deck focuses on building a fast and aggressive board presence with low-cost creatures and pump effects. It aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game with a swarm of weenies and protect them with disruptive cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. Mutavault and Cavern of Souls provide additional creature support and help ensure that the deck can continue to apply pressure even if the opponent tries to disrupt the board. Adeline, Resplendent Cathar serves as a powerful finisher, rewarding the player for maintaining a wide board presence.

The main strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of powerful spirit creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Supreme Phantom and Spell Queller to boost spirits and counter opponent spells, alongside efficient draw options like Curious Obsession, the deck aims to maintain aggressive board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Geistlight Snare and Get Lost further adds to the deck's disruptive nature, making it difficult for the opponent to execute their strategy effectively.
